intro: [WRONG START] Boronia membranacea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boronias, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Boronia membranacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
